intro: Convolvulus oleifolius var. pumilus, commonly known as the dwarf yellow morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, funnel-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often blooming in the early morning. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
